content.heading: <canvas> Tag
paragraphs: The <canvas> tag is a container for drawing graphics via JavaScript.

Example: <canvas id="myCanvas">Your browser does not support canvas.</canvas><script>let canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas"); let ctx = canvas.getContext("2d"); ctx.fillStyle = "#FF0000"; ctx.fillRect(0, 0, 80, 80);</script>

content.heading: Browser Support
paragraphs: Supported by Chrome 4.0, Edge 9.0, Firefox 2.0, Safari 3.1, Opera 9.0.

content.heading: Examples
paragraphs: Transparent rectangles: <canvas id="myCanvas">Your browser does not support canvas.</canvas><script>let c = document.getElementById("myCanvas"); let ctx = c.getContext("2d"); ctx.fillStyle = "red"; ctx.fillRect(20, 20, 75, 50); ctx.globalAlpha = 0.2; ctx.fillStyle = "blue"; ctx.fillRect(50, 50, 75, 50); ctx.fillStyle = "green"; ctx.fillRect(80, 80, 75, 50);</script>
